conclusion: The problem involves finding the position of a particle at t = 8 seconds using a velocity-time graph.
The particle starts at x = 5 meters at t = 0 and moves in the positive direction initially.
The area under a v-t graph gives the displacement of the particle during a certain time interval.

premise: The area under a v-t graph gives the displacement. Initial position is 5m.
conclusion: Position at any time t is initial position plus displacement traveled up to that time.
From t = 0 to t = 1 second, velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s.
From t = 1 to t = 4 seconds, velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
From t = 4 to t = 5 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -1 m/s.
From t = 5 to t = 7 seconds, velocity is constant at -1 m/s.
From t = 7 to t = 8 seconds, velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s.
